input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
The second week of the year was filled with a flurry of activity, both at work and at home. At the lab, we were deep into the planning stages of our new projects, with brainstorming sessions and design meetings taking place daily. I was particularly excited about a new collaboration with a local architectural firm, which could lead to some groundbreaking advancements in sustainable urban design. Meanwhile, at home, my wife and I were busy preparing for our eldest child's sixth birthday, which was just around the corner. We spent hours poring over party ideas, crafting invitations, and planning games and activities. The kids were thrilled at the prospect of a birthday party, and the anticipation was palpable. The week also brought some unexpected weather changes, with temperatures soaring to a balmy 10°C, melting the remaining snow and heralding the arrival of spring. This sudden shift in weather was a welcome change, bringing a renewed sense of energy and optimism.

At the lab, we were making steady progress on our new projects, with several key milestones reached and new collaborations forming. Meanwhile, at home, the preparations for our eldest child's birthday party were in full swing. We spent the week finalizing the guest list, ordering decorations, and planning the menu. The kids were excitedly counting down the days, and the anticipation was palpable. The week also brought some interesting weather changes, with temperatures fluctuating wildly from day to day. This unpredictability was a reminder that, even in the dead of winter, nature still holds the power to surprise us.

Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Noah is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 22), my wife (birthday on September 03), my child_1 (birthday on March 21), my father (birthday on February 16), my mother (birthday on February 04), 
2) Week-long road trip across the Pacific Coast Highway in week 27-28.

3) Join a historical walking tour of the city every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 51 for graphic design studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 55 for music school use.
  - Designate Floor 7 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for small cinema use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 63 to 67 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 19 for pharmacy use.
  - Designate Floor 74 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for yoga studio use.
  - Designate Floor 10 for daycare center use.
  - Designate Floor 34 for photography studio use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 28 to 33 for a hospital with various departments.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a outdoor terrace every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for real estate agency use.
  - Designate Floor 77 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 71 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for veterinary clinic use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for retail store use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 3 to 9 for a advanced technology and research institute.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. The design is functional and efficient, with easy access to all areas of the building's infrastructure.

Common areas, such as break rooms and collaboration spaces, are designed to promote creativity and productivity.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are succulent and sweet, while the cocktail sauce adds a tangy, spicy kick.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the savory, aromatic cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich, velvety sauce clings to the tender lobster meat, creating a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin gives way to juicy, flavorful meat, while the sweet orange glaze adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze adds a touch of sweetness and a beautiful sheen to the carrots, making them a delightful and colorful addition to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and intense chocolate flavor make this a decadent and indulgent dessert that is sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee flavor is bold and rich, while the creamy mascarpone cheese adds a luxurious and velvety texture.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. The wines are carefully chosen to enhance the flavors of the dishes, creating a harmonious and enjoyable dining experience.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new year and the start of a year filled with gourmet experiences.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and comforting, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread. The rich, savory flavors of the onions are beautifully complemented by the savory broth and the crispy, toasted bread on top.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a blend of cheeses. The dip is served with warm pita bread, making it a perfect appetizer for sharing.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French stew made with tender beef, red wine, onions, garlic, and mushrooms. The rich, bold flavors of the wine and the tender, juicy beef make this a hearty and satisfying dish.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting, homestyle dish made with tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust. The savory filling is topped with a golden, crispy crust, making it a perfect dish for a cozy night in.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy, sweet potatoes mashed with a touch of butter and a hint of cinnamon. The subtle sweetness of the potatoes is beautifully complemented by the savory main courses.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Tender green beans sautéed with garlic and almonds. The crunchy almonds add a delightful texture and a nutty, savory flavor to the dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The sweet, tart flavors of the apples are beautifully complemented by the crispy, buttery topping and the creamy ice cream.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake made with the finest cocoa and topped with a silky chocolate ganache. The intense chocolate flavor is sure to satisfy even the most discerning sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A selection of bold, full-bodied red wines to complement the rich, savory flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich, velvety hot chocolate made with the finest chocolate and topped with whipped cream. The perfect dessert drink to warm up on a cold winter night.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for a mid-winter palate cleanser.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian appetizer made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze. The fresh, juicy tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, and fragrant basil make for a delightful and refreshing start to the meal.
1.2) Shrimp Ceviche: A refreshing, citrusy dish made with fresh shrimp, lime juice, red onion, and cilantro. The bright, zesty flavors of the lime juice and the fresh, succulent shrimp make for a perfect appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Fish of the Day: A light, flavorful fish grilled to perfection and served with a citrusy butter sauce. The delicate, tender flavor of the fish is beautifully complemented by the bright, zesty flavors of the sauce.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, fresh vegetables, and a tangy vinaigrette. The nutty, slightly crunchy texture of the quinoa is beautifully complemented by the fresh, crisp vegetables and the tangy vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender, grilled asparagus served with a lemon butter sauce. The bright, slightly sweet flavor of the asparagus is beautifully complemented by the tangy, buttery sauce.
3.2) Roasted Beets: Roasted beets served with a tangy vinaigrette. The earthy, slightly sweet flavor of the beets is beautifully complemented by the tangy, zesty vinaigrette.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy, zesty lemon tart with a buttery, flaky crust. The bright, zesty flavors of the lemon curd are beautifully complemented by the buttery, flaky crust.
4.2) Fresh Fruit Salad: A refreshing, light dessert made with a variety of fresh fruits and a tangy citrus dressing. The sweet, juicy flavors of the fruits are beautifully complemented by the tangy, zesty dressing.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A selection of crisp, refreshing white wines to complement the light, refreshing flavors of the main courses and desserts.
5.2) Iced Tea: A selection of refreshing, flavorful iced teas to quench your thirst and cleanse your palate between courses.
 Menu Week 4:
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the tomatoes and basil are beautifully complemented by the tangy, slightly sweet balsamic glaze and the crispy, toasted bread.
1.2) Calamari: Crispy, golden-fried calamari served with a tangy marinara sauce. The tender, juicy calamari is beautifully complemented by the crispy, golden breading and the tangy, savory marinara sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Veal Parmesan: Tender, breaded veal cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the marinara sauce and the melted, gooey mozzarella cheese are beautifully complemented by the tender, juicy veal.
2.2) Spaghetti Bolognese: Hearty, savory spaghetti dish made with a rich, meaty bolognese sauce. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the meat and tomato sauce are beautifully complemented by the tender, al dente spaghetti.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy, garlic-infused mashed potatoes. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the garlic are beautifully complemented by the creamy, buttery texture of the mashed potatoes.
3.2) Roasted Broccoli: Tender, roasted broccoli served with a tangy, lemon-garlic aioli. The slightly sweet, slightly bitter flavors of the broccoli are beautifully complemented by the tangy, zesty aioli.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert made with ladyfingers, espresso, and mascarpone cheese. The rich, coffee-infused flavors of the dessert are beautifully complemented by the light, airy texture of the mascarpone cheese and the tender, slightly sweet ladyfingers.
4.2) Chocolate Mousse: Rich, velvety chocolate mousse. The intense, decadent chocolate flavor is beautifully complemented by the light, airy texture of the mousse.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A selection of bold, full-bodied red wines to complement the rich, savory flavors of the main courses and the decadent desserts.
5.2) Espresso: A selection of rich, bold espressos to enhance the coffee flavors in the tiramisu and to provide a delightful finish to the meal.
# Menu for Week 5
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Cocktail: Succulent, fresh shrimp served with a zesty cocktail sauce. The sweet, briny flavors of the shrimp are beautifully complemented by the tangy, slightly spicy cocktail sauce.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the tomatoes and basil are beautifully complemented by the tangy, slightly sweet balsamic glaze and the crispy, toasted bread.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Ribeye Steak: Juicy, flavorful ribeye steak served with a red wine reduction sauce. The rich, savory flavors of the steak are beautifully complemented by the tangy, slightly sweet red wine reduction sauce.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that warm the soul and bring comfort during the cold winter months.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A hearty stew made with tender beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Green beans sautéed with almonds and browned butter.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A classic Southern dessert made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich, velvety hot chocolate made with real chocolate and milk.
5.2) Mulled Wine: A warm, spiced red wine perfect for sipping on a cold winter night.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, garlic, basil, and a drizzle of olive oil.
1.2) Hummus: A creamy, savory dip made with chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Paella: A Spanish rice dish made with saffron, chicken, shrimp, and vegetables.
2.2) Lamb Kebabs: Tender lamb skewers marinated in a blend of herbs and spices, grilled to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: A simple yet delicious side dish made with grilled asparagus and a lemon-garlic dressing.
3.2) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, and a citrus vinaigrette.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich, sweet dessert made with layers of phyllo dough, honey, and nuts.
4.2) Turkish Delight: A traditional Turkish dessert made with rosewater, cornstarch, and chopped nuts.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sangria: A refreshing, fruity drink made with red wine, fruit, and brandy.
5.2) Horchata: A creamy, rice-based drink popular in Mexican cuisine.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of Asia.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with salt and served with a squeeze of lemon.
1.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy, golden rolls filled with vegetables and served with a sweet and sour dipping sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Teriyaki Chicken: Tender chicken marinated in a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce, grilled to perfection.
2.2) Pad Thai: A classic Thai dish made with rice noodles, shrimp, peanuts, and a tangy tamarind sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A flavorful side dish made with rice, vegetables, and scrambled eggs.
3.2) Steamed Broccoli: A simple yet delicious side dish made with steamed broccoli and a garlic-ginger sauce.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Mochi: A traditional Japanese dessert made with sweet rice cake and a filling of red bean paste or ice cream.
4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: A refreshing, creamy ice cream infused with green tea flavor.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sake: A traditional Japanese rice wine served chilled or warmed.
5.2) Thai Iced Tea: A sweet, aromatic iced tea made with black tea, milk, and sugar.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu celebrates the flavors of Italy.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with a mixture of tomatoes, garlic, basil, and olive oil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Spaghetti Bolognese: A hearty, savory pasta dish made with a meaty tomato sauce and served with grated Parmesan cheese.
2.2) Chicken Parmesan: A breaded and fried chicken cutlet topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Knots: Soft, buttery bread dough twisted into knots and baked with garlic butter.
3.2) Roasted Vegetables: A colorful and flavorful side dish made with a variety of roasted vegetables.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Tiramisu: A rich, coffee-flavored dessert made with layers of ladyfingers, mascarpone cheese, and espresso.
4.2) Cannoli: A classic Sicilian dessert made with crispy fried shells filled with sweet ricotta cheese and chocolate chips.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Chianti: A red wine from the Chianti region of Italy, known for its bold, fruity flavors.
5.2) Limoncello: A refreshing Italian lemon liqueur, perfect for sipping on its own or as a digestif.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - 11th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of Mexico.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Guacamole: A classic Mexican dip made with mashed avocados, lime juice, onions, and cilantro.
1.2) Quesadillas: A warm, cheesy tortilla filled with a variety of ingredients, such as chicken, beans, or vegetables.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Enchiladas: Corn tortillas filled with shredded chicken, cheese, and chili sauce, topped with more sauce and sour cream.
2.2) Fajitas: Grilled strips of beef, chicken, or shrimp served with warm tortillas, beans, rice, and a variety of toppings.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mexican Rice: A flavorful rice dish made with tomatoes, onions, garlic, and spices.
3.2) Black Beans: A hearty, savory side dish made with black beans, onions, garlic, and a hint of chili powder.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Churros: Fried dough pastry coated in cinnamon sugar and served with a chocolate dipping sauce.
4.2) Flan: A rich, creamy custard dessert flavored with vanilla and caramel.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Margarita: A classic Mexican cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and triple sec.
5.2) Horchata: A refreshing rice-based drink flavored with cinnamon and vanilla.
 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - 18th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of India.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Samosas: Triangular-shaped pastries filled with a savory mixture of potatoes, peas, and spices.
1.2) Pakoras: Crispy fritters made with chickpea flour and a variety of vegetables, served with a tangy tamarind chutney.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Butter Chicken: Tender pieces of chicken cooked in a rich, creamy tomato-based sauce.
2.2) Chana Masala: A vegetarian dish made with chickpeas simmered in a flavorful tomato-based sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Basmati Rice: A fragrant, long-grain rice that is a staple in Indian cuisine.
3.2) Naan Bread: A soft, leavened flatbread that is perfect for soaking up sauces and curries.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Gulab Jamun: Soft, spongy balls made from milk solids, soaked in a sweet, sticky syrup.
4.2) Ras Malai: A sweet, creamy dessert made with chhena (Indian cottage cheese) and flavored with cardamom and saffron.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Masala Chai: A fragrant, spiced tea made with a blend of herbs and spices.
5.2) Mango Lassi: A refreshing, sweet yogurt-based drink flavored with ripe mangoes.
 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - 25th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Tzatziki: A cool, creamy yogurt-based dip made with cucumber, garlic, and dill.
1.2) Falafel: Crispy, golden balls made from chickpeas, herbs, and spices, served with pita bread and tahini sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Paella: A Spanish rice dish made with saffron, chicken, seafood, and vegetables.
2.2) Gyro: A Greek dish made with marinated lamb, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, and tzatziki sauce, wrapped in pita bread.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Greek Salad: A refreshing salad made with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, feta cheese, and a tangy vinaigrette.
3.2) Roasted Vegetables: A colorful and flavorful side dish made with a variety of vegetables, roasted to perfection.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich, sweet dessert made with layers of phyllo dough, nuts, and honey syrup.
4.2) Turkish Delight: A traditional Turkish dessert made with a gel-like consistency, flavored with rosewater, pistachios, and other nuts.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sangria: A Spanish wine punch made with fruit, brandy, and orange juice.
5.2) Ouzo: A Greek anise-flavored liqueur, often enjoyed as an aperitif or digestif.
 Menu Week 9 (February 26th - March 4th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of the Caribbean.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Jerk Wings: Spicy, savory chicken wings marinated in a Jamaican jerk seasoning and grilled to perfection.
1.2) Plantains: Fried ripe plantains, sweet and caramelized on the outside, soft and tender on the inside.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Jamaican Jerk Chicken: Tender, juicy chicken marinated in a spicy, savory jerk seasoning and grilled.
2.2) Rice and Beans: A classic Caribbean side dish made with rice, kidney beans, and a variety of herbs and spices.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Plantains: Thin slices of green plantains, fried until crispy and golden brown.
3.2) Coleslaw: A refreshing, tangy slaw made with cabbage, carrots, and a dressing made with mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Pineapple Upside-Down Cake: A classic dessert made with pineapple slices caramelized in butter and sugar, topped with a moist, golden cake.
4.2) Coconut Cream Pie: A rich, creamy pie filled with coconut milk, topped with a layer of whipped cream and toasted coconut.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Rum Punch: A refreshing, fruity cocktail made with rum, pineapple juice, orange juice, and a variety of other tropical fruits.
5.2) Mojito: A classic Cuban cocktail made with rum, lime juice, mint, and sugar.
 Menu Week 10 (March 5th - 11th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of the Middle East.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Hummus: A classic Middle Eastern dip made with chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice.
1.2) Falafel: Crispy, golden balls made from chickpeas, herbs, and spices, served with pita bread and tahini sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Shawarma: A Middle Eastern dish made with marinated chicken, lamb, or beef, served in a pita bread with pickles, tomatoes, and tahini sauce.
2.2) Kebab: Grilled skewers of marinated meat, served with a side of rice, flatbread, and a variety of vegetables and sauces.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Tabouleh: A refreshing salad made with parsley, mint, bulgur, tomatoes, onions, and a lemon-olive oil dressing.
3.2) Grilled Vegetables: A colorful and flavorful side dish made with a variety of vegetables, grilled to perfection.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich, sweet dessert made with layers of phyllo dough, chopped nuts, and honey syrup.
4.2) Gulab Jamun: Soft, spongy balls made from milk solids, soaked in a sweet, sticky syrup flavored with cardamom and saffron.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Mint Tea: A refreshing, aromatic tea made with fresh mint leaves and black tea.
5.2) Arabic Coffee: A strong, flavorful coffee made with cardamom and served in a traditional Arabic coffee pot.
 Menu Week 11 (March 12th - 18th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of Africa.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Moroccan Spiced Carrots: Roasted carrots seasoned with a fragrant blend of Moroccan spices, including cumin, coriander, and paprika.
1.2) Jollof Rice Balls: Fried rice balls made with a base of jollof rice, a West African dish made with rice, tomatoes, and spices.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Tagine: A North African stew made with chicken, apricots, almonds, and a blend of spices, served over couscous.
2.2) Ethiopian Vegetarian Platter: A colorful and flavorful collection of vegetarian dishes, including lentils, split peas, and cabbage, served with injera bread.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Collard Greens: A traditional Southern African dish made with collard greens, onions, garlic, and a smoky ham hock.
3.2) Sweet Potato Fries: Crispy, golden sweet potato fries seasoned with a blend of African spices.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Malva Pudding: A South African dessert made with apricot jam, coconut, and a rich, buttery sauce.
4.2) Fufu: A traditional West African dish made from pounded yams or plantains, served with a savory stew or soup.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Rooibos Tea: A caffeine-free tea made from the leaves of the rooibos plant, native to South Africa.
5.2) Baobab Smoothie: A refreshing, tropical drink made with baobab fruit, bananas, and coconut milk.
 Menu Week 12 (March 19th - 25th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of South America.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Ceviche: A refreshing Peruvian dish made with raw fish marinated in citrus juices and mixed with onions, cilantro, and chili peppers.
1.2) Empanadas: Fried or baked pastries filled with savory meat, cheese, or vegetables, originating from various South American countries.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chimichurri Steak: A Argentinean dish featuring a juicy, flavorful steak topped with a tangy, herb-based chimichurri sauce.
2.2) Moqueca: A Brazilian fish stew made with coconut milk, dendê oil, and a variety of tropical fruits and vegetables.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Black Beans and Rice: A classic side dish made with black beans, rice, onions, garlic, and a variety of spices.
3.2) Plantains: Fried or roasted plantains, a staple in many South American cuisines.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Dulce de Leche Flan: A rich, creamy dessert made with caramelized milk and eggs, popular in many South American countries.
4.2) Churros: Fried dough pastries coated in sugar and cinnamon, often served with a side of chocolate sauce for dipping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Pisco Sour: A popular Peruvian cocktail made with pisco brandy, lime juice, simple syrup, and an egg white.
5.2) Mate: A traditional Argentinean drink made by steeping dried leaves of the yerba mate plant in hot water and drinking it through a hollow gourd with a metal straw.
#* Menu Week 13 (March 26th - April 1st):
This week's menu is inspired by the flavors of Southeast Asia.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Satay: Marinated skewers of meat, often chicken or beef, grilled and served with a peanut dipping sauce.
1.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy, golden-brown rolls filled with vegetables, meat, or tofu, and served with a sweet and sour dipping sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Pad Thai: A classic Thai dish made with stir-fried rice noodles, shrimp, eggs, vegetables, and a tangy, sweet and sour sauce.
2.2) Nasi Lemak: A Malaysian dish featuring fragrant rice cooked in coconut milk, served with a variety of side dishes, including fried anchovies, peanuts, and sambal chili sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A versatile side dish made with cooked rice, vegetables, and a variety of proteins, seasoned with soy sauce and other Asian flavors.
3.2) Steamed Bok Choy: A Chinese vegetable dish made with bok choy, garlic, and ginger, steamed to perfection.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: A popular Thai dessert made with sweet, ripe mangoes and sticky rice, often served with a coconut milk sauce.
4.2) Banana Fritters: Deep-fried banana slices coated in a sweet batter, a popular dessert in many Southeast Asian countries.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Singha Beer: A Thai beer with a rich, full-bodied flavor and a golden hue.
5.2) Thai Iced Tea: A sweet, aromatic tea made with black tea, milk, sugar, and a variety of spices, served over ice.
# Menu Week 14 (April 2nd - 8th):
This week's menu is inspired by the flavors of Eastern Europe.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Pierogi: Boiled or fried Polish dumplings filled with savory fillings like potatoes, cheese, or sauerkraut, and served with sour cream or butter.
1.2) Sausage Platter: A selection of smoked or grilled Eastern European sausages, such as kielbasa, bratwurst, or knockwurst, served with mustard, sauerkraut, and rye bread.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Paprikash: A Hungarian dish featuring chicken cooked in a savory, sweet paprika-based sauce and served over egg noodles or rice.
2.2) Golabki: A Polish dish made with cabbage leaves stuffed with a mixture of ground meat, rice, and onions, baked in a tomato sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Potato Pancakes: Thin, crispy pancakes made from grated potatoes, onions, and eggs, often served with applesauce or sour cream.
3.2) Sauerkraut: Fermented cabbage, a staple in Eastern European cuisine, often served as a side dish or used as a base for other dishes.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Sacher-Torte: A rich, chocolate cake from Austria, often filled with apricot jam and topped with a thin layer of chocolate glaze.
4.2) Strudel: A layered pastry filled with fruit, often apples, and topped with a caramelized sugar glaze.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Pilsner Urquell: A classic Czech beer with a crisp, clean taste and a golden color.
5.2) Slivovitz: A fruit brandy popular in Eastern European countries, often made from plums or other fruits.
# Menu Week 15 (April 9th - 15th):
This week's menu is inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted Italian bread topped with a mixture of diced tomatoes, garlic, basil, and olive oil.
1.2) Tapenade: A savory spread made from olives, capers, anchovies, and olive oil, often served with toasted bread or crackers.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Paella: A Spanish rice dish made with saffron, vegetables, and a variety of proteins, such as chicken, seafood, or rabbit.
2.2) Lamb Tagine: A Moroccan stew made with tender lamb, apricots, almonds, and a blend of aromatic spices, served over couscous.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Vegetables: A colorful assortment of vegetables, such as zucchini, eggplant, and bell peppers, grilled to perfection.
3.2) Greek Salad: A refreshing salad made with tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, feta cheese, and olives, dressed with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich, sweet pastry made with layers of phyllo dough, chopped nuts, and honey syrup, a popular dessert in Middle Eastern and Mediterranean countries.
4.2) Tiramisu: An Italian dessert made with ladyfingers, espresso, mascarpone cheese, and cocoa powder.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sangria: A Spanish drink made with red wine, fruit, and brandy, often served over ice and garnished with fruit.
5.2) Ouzo: A popular Greek anise-flavored liqueur, often enjoyed as an aperitif or digestif.
# Menu Week 16 (April 16th - 22nd):
This week's menu is inspired by the flavors of the Middle East.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Falafel: Deep-fried balls made from chickpeas, herbs, and spices, often served with pita bread and tahini sauce.
1.2) Hummus: A creamy, savory dip made from chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice, often served with pita bread or vegetables.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Shawarma: A Middle Eastern dish featuring marinated meat, such as chicken or lamb, cooked on a vertical rotisserie and served in a pita bread with vegetables and sauces.
2.2) Kebab: Grilled skewers of meat, often lamb or chicken, marinated in a blend of spices and served with rice, flatbread, and vegetables.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Tabouleh: A refreshing salad made with parsley, bulgur, tomatoes, onions, and mint, dressed with olive oil and lemon juice.
3.2) Rice Pilaf: A flavorful rice dish made with saffron, onions, and a variety of spices, often served as a side dish with Middle Eastern entrees.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich, sweet pastry made with layers of phyllo dough, chopped nuts, and honey syrup.
4.2) Gulab Jamun: Soft, spongy balls made from milk solids, soaked in a sweet, sticky syrup flavored with cardamom and saffron.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Mint Tea: A popular Middle Eastern beverage made by steeping fresh mint leaves in hot water and sweetening with sugar.
5.2) Arak: A Middle Eastern anise-flavored liqueur, often enjoyed as an aperitif or digestif.
# Menu Week 17 (April 23rd - 29th):
This week's menu is inspired by the flavors of South America.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Empanadas: Fried or baked pastries filled with savory meat, cheese, or vegetable fillings, originating from various South American countries.
1.2) Ceviche: A refreshing dish made from raw fish marinated in citrus juices, often served with onions, peppers, and avocado.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chimichurri Steak: A Argentinean dish featuring a juicy, flavorful steak topped with a tangy, herb-based chimichurri sauce.
2.2) Moqueca: A Brazilian fish stew made with coconut milk, dendê oil, and a variety of tropical fruits and vegetables.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Black Beans and Rice: A classic side dish made with black beans, rice, and various seasonings, often served with Latin American entrees.
3.2) Plantains: Fried or roasted sweet plantains, a popular side dish in many South American countries.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Flan: A rich, creamy dessert made with caramelized sugar, milk, eggs, and vanilla, originating from Spain but widely popular in South America.
4.2) Dulce de Leche: A sweet, creamy dessert made from condensed milk that has been slowly cooked, often used as a filling or topping for cakes, pastries, and other desserts.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Pisco Sour: A popular Peruvian cocktail made with pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, and an egg white, often served with a dash of Angostura bitters.
5.2) Caipirinha: A classic Brazilian cocktail made with cachaça, sugar, and lime, often served over ice.
# Menu Week 18 (April 30th - May 6th):
This week's menu is inspired by the flavors of India.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Samosas: Triangular-shaped pastries filled with savory spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat, often served with chutney.
1.2) Pakora: Deep-fried fritters made from a batter of chickpea flour and various vegetables, often served with chutney or raita.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Butter Chicken: A rich, creamy Indian dish featuring tender chicken pieces cooked in a tomato-based gravy flavored with butter and spices.
2.2) Chana Masala: A popular vegetarian Indian dish made with chickpeas simmered in a flavorful tomato-based sauce with spices and garam masala.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Basmati Rice: A fragrant, long-grain rice often used in Indian and Middle Eastern cuisine, often served as a side dish or base for various dishes.
3.2) Naan Bread: A soft, leavened flatbread commonly used in Indian and Middle Eastern cuisine, often served with various curries and stews.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Gulab Jamun: Soft, round balls made from milk solids, soaked in a sweet, sticky syrup flavored with cardamom and rosewater.
4.2) Rasmalai: Soft, spongy balls made from chhena and semolina, soaked in a sweet, thickened milk flavored with cardamom and topped with chopped nuts.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Masala Chai: A popular Indian tea made by brewing black tea with a blend of aromatic spices, milk, and sugar.
5.2) Mango Lassi: A refreshing, sweet yogurt-based drink made with ripe mangoes, often blended with ice and cardamom.
# Menu Week 19 (May 7th - 13th):
This week's menu is inspired by the flavors of Italy.
1. Antipasti:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread rubbed with garlic, topped with diced tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
1.2) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian dish featuring fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, basil, and a drizzle of olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
2. Primi:
2.1) Spaghetti Bolognese: A hearty Italian dish featuring spaghetti pasta tossed in a rich, savory meat-based sauce.
2.2) Fettuccine Alfredo: A classic Italian pasta dish made with fettuccine noodles tossed in a creamy, buttery sauce flavored with garlic and parmesan cheese.
3. Secondi:
3.1) Pollo alla Marsala: A delicious Italian dish featuring chicken breasts cooked in a sweet, savory Marsala wine sauce.
3.2) Vitello Tonnato: A unique Italian dish featuring thinly sliced veal topped with a tuna-based sauce made with olive oil, capers, and anchovies.
4. Contorno:
4.1) Roasted Vegetables: A colorful and flavorful side dish featuring a variety of seasonal vegetables roasted to perfection.
4.2) Polenta: A traditional Italian side dish made from cornmeal, often served as a base for various savory dishes.
5. Dolci:
5.1) Tiramisu: A rich, creamy Italian dessert made with ladyfingers, espresso, mascarpone cheese, and cocoa powder.
5.2) Gelato: A classic Italian ice cream made with milk, sugar, and flavorings

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichokes, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy Alfredo sauce, served over pasta.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
3.2) Garlic Roasted Vegetables: A medley of vegetables roasted with garlic and herbs.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar.
4.2) Chocolate Brownies: Rich, fudgy brownies topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines to pair with the savory dishes.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing, non-alcoholic option for those who prefer not to drink alcohol.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with tomatoes, basil, garlic, and a drizzle of olive oil.
1.2) Crab Cakes: Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with breadcrumbs, herbs, and spices, pan-fried until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Tender beef simmered in a rich red wine sauce with carrots, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Vegetarian Paella: A Spanish rice dish made with saffron, vegetables, and beans.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy green beans sautéed with almonds and garlic.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert with a caramelized sugar top and a rich custard base.
4.2) Lemon Tart: A tangy, sweet dessert made with a lemon curd filling and a buttery crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines to complement the hearty dishes.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, rich, and indulgent drink made with real chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
Winter Delights.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh oysters served on the half shell with a mignonette sauce.
1.2) Cheese and Charcuterie Board: A selection of artisanal cheeses, cured meats, and accompaniments.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken cooked in red wine with bacon, mushrooms, and onions.
2.2) Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie: A hearty vegetarian pie made with lentils, vegetables, and a mashed potato topping.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Parsnips: Parsnips mashed with butter, milk, and a hint of nutmeg.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baked Alaska: A frozen dessert with a cake base, ice cream, and a meringue topping.
4.2) Chocolate Soufflé: A rich, decadent dessert made with chocolate and eggs, baked to order.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines to enhance the flavors of the dishes.
5.2) Hot Toddy: A warm, comforting drink made with whiskey, lemon, honey, and cinnamon.
 Menu Week 5 (February 5th - February 11th):
Valentine's Day Special.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Cocktail: Succulent shrimp served with a tangy cocktail sauce.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that warm the soul and nourish the body.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A hearty stew made with tender beef, red wine, onions, carrots, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with a touch of brown sugar and a splash of milk.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm and comforting dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A classic Southern dessert with a gooey pecan filling and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm and comforting beverage made with real chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for the winter season.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian appetizer made with fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and basil.
1.2) Shrimp Ceviche: Raw shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with red onion, cilantro, and jalapeño.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: A flavorful and healthy main course with grilled salmon, asparagus, and a lemon butter sauce.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A light and refreshing salad made with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and a citrus vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled to perfection and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Quinoa: A nutritious and flavorful side dish made with cooked quinoa and a touch of olive oil.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy and sweet dessert made with a lemon curd filling and a crisp tart shell.
4.2) Fresh Fruit Salad: A light and refreshing dessert made with a variety of fresh fruits.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp and refreshing white wine to pair with the light flavors of the menu.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing and caffeine-free beverage made with real tea leaves and served over ice.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and satisfying, perfect for a cozy night in.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy and flavorful dip made with spinach, artichokes, and cheese.
1.2) Meatballs: Tender meatballs served with a tangy tomato sauce and a side of crusty bread.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that warm the soul and nourish the body.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Caprese Skewers: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef in a rich red wine sauce with carrots, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish with tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: Parsnips, carrots, and beets roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with a touch of brown sugar and butter.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm and comforting dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A classic Southern dessert with a gooey pecan filling and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich, velvety hot chocolate made with real chocolate and milk.
5.2) Mulled Wine: A festive drink made with red wine, spices, and orange slices.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu focuses on light and refreshing dishes to start the year off right.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with red onion, cilantro, and jalapeño.
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon seasoned with herbs and grilled to perfection, served with a lemon butter sauce.

Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (1, 7) for hospital use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 2) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 7) for fire station use.

2) Range block requirements: Allocate a cultural quarter along the row from (1, 3) to (1, 4).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
